result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eddie Perez in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #14CF437.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant allowed 2 phone calls for purposes of legal counsel and obtaining bail.  Defendant to have no contact with alleged victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program - exempt while defendant is on Huber Bailee Status. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to disclose all prescriptions to the jail administration.  Defendant granted Huber Bailee status if the signature bond in 14CF1456 is signed.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Eddie Perez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
